qas.question: The Cathedral Basilica of St. Louis holds the largest what?
What along texas interstate Highways contains everyday examples of mosaics?
Which station in the NYC subway has a modern example of mosaic?

answers.text: the Museum of Natural History station

qas.question: Edward Burne-Jones is noted for creating mosaics in what century?

context: Noted <a3_0>19th<a3_0/>-century mosaics include those by Edward Burne-Jones at St Pauls within the Walls in Rome. Another modern mosaic of note is the world's largest <a0_0>mosaic installation<a0_0/> located at the Cathedral Basilica of St. Louis, located in St. Louis, Missouri. A modern example of mosaic is <a2_0>the Museum of Natural History station<a2_0/> of the New York City Subway (there are many such works of art scattered throughout the New York City subway system, though many IND stations are usually designed with bland mosaics.) Another example of mosaics in ordinary surroundings is the use of locally themed mosaics in some restrooms in <a1_0>the rest areas<a1_0/> along some Texas interstate highways.
